alert.note: Alert for Imperial; Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 30 at 4:09PM PDT until July 30 at 4:45PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Western Imperial County in southeastern California... Riverside County in southern California... * Until 445 PM PDT. * At 409 PM PDT, a dust channel was 9 miles south of Bombay Beach, or 11 miles east of Salton City, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 8 between mile markers 9 and 16. CA Route 78 between mile markers 1 and 13. CA Route 111 between mile markers 38 and 65. Locations impacted include... Salton City, Ocotillo, North Shore, Salton Sea Beach, Desert Shores, Bombay Beach, Ocotillo Wells, Hwy S2 Vallecito Creek Rd, Fish Creek Wash, Slab City, Coyote Wells, Imperial Hot Mineral Springs, Coolidge Springs, Niland and Winona. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
